summary: The 'Mortgage Relief for Disaster Survivors Act' proposes providing forbearance assistance to borrowers with federally backed mortgage loans on properties located in disaster areas. Borrowers can request a forbearance of up to 180 days, with a possible extension. The bill stipulates no additional fees, penalties, or interest accrual beyond the standard schedule during the forbearance period. It applies to disasters declared on or after January 1, 2025.
